Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2010 03:48PM daisym wrote: Soonermagpie, Good Luck to you.  I too have to wait according to my period.  Tomorrow would be a great day for my MRI according to my cycle; however, here in Canada things are very slow.  Average wait time for an MRI in my province is 8 months!!!!  Apparently there are 8 catagories and I am classified as a 2.  You are so lucky to be in the US!!!!!! Maggie
Posts.Title: MRI scheduled soonermagpie daniel9ds

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2010 04:17PM daisym wrote: Thanks Mantra:  Have sent you a PM with my contact information.  Yes, I would definitely drive.  I talked with another Physician and she mentioned that MRI's are mainly used a diagnositc tool with how to proceed with surgery; therefore, she recommended staying with the one that my Surgeon has suggested (one of two hospitals that do that type of MRI here in NB.)  Somedays I am okay with waiting and others I just want to grab my credit card and head stateside to have it done.  Surely to goodness if my Surgeon felt it was something untoward he would have insisted on going sooner?   Maggie
Posts.Title: MRI scheduled soonermagpie daniel9ds

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2010 04:34PM daisym wrote: Mantra: That was the feeling I got from the Dr's here.  My Dr. picked the hospital where I have to go for the MRI as he feels they will be best suited to diagnose whatever is going on.  I believe they have a breast clinic there as well and are equipped to deal with whatever may arise.  I just feel it is a long time. I hope your MRI turned out okay. Maggie

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2010 02:29PM daisym wrote: Hi:  Just wondering how long you have to wait for your MRI?  I went for Mammo on Sept. 27.  They did 3 Mammos and a US.  Then told to go for an MRI.  Originally booked for March 21 of next year, but surgeon has bumped up to Jan 6 and also am on cancellation list.  Should I be concerned?  Area found is on RB and approx. 2 inches at 11 o'clock.  I was told a biopsy was not a favourable option due to the size of the mass and removal (of the complete mass) would be breast reconstruction.  I am in Canada and feeling very worrisome as I wait.  I discovered small lump awhile ago.....but never dreamed it would be this.  Any advice?  Should I consider going state side?
